article_title: Insider-Trading Case Involving GE Capital Tip Is New Test for SEC
article_text:
Fresh off a major courtroom victory, the Securities and Exchange Commission will test its insider-trading theories in another long-running case that is set for trial on Monday.

Regulators allege Nelson J. Obus, a principal at New York-based hedge fund Wynnefield Capital Inc., traded on an inside tip about an acquisition he received from one of his analysts. The analyst had allegedly received the tip from a college friend at General Electric Capital Corp., which was exploring acting as a lender in the deal. The GE Capital...
